intro: Gibasis gypsophila, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that help reduce water loss. Gibasis gypsophila is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in xeriscaped gardens.
